|vendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |device_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subvendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subdevice_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = JIC-KNW-PCM11,M4Y-XI-300 |icid = <!-- Industry Canada ID, Leave blank for none --> |boardid = <!-- Board ID --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = <!-- OUI -->

|antconn = RP-MMCX |antenna = <!-- Antenna type --> |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = <!-- Receive sensitivity --> |transmit_power = <!-- Transmit power -->

}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== The '''Kingston''' FCC ID for this device is a Change in Identification entry with no public note of which entry it is redirecting to. However, the device is obviously a '''Z-Com''' XI-300 (removable antenna model, with antenna module installed).
[http://www.pcmag.com/article/print/5079 Kingston Delivers Cable-Free Connectivity] :Small review from 2001 about this and the [[Kingston KNW-USB11]]
The driver for this device has two different PCMCIA strings for the device.. *<small>PCMCIA\Kingston-KNW-PCM11-0000</small> **probably 3.3V *<small>PCMCIA\Kingston-KNW-PCM11-5FAE</small> **probably 5V
==Pictures== <center><gallery caption="from the PC Magazine review"> File:Kingston EtheRx PCMCIA and USB.jpg| </gallery></center>[[Has images::external| ]]
